notes: On 28 June 2024, in Zapotlan de Juarez, Hidalgo, approximately 35 people demonstrated at the municipal presidency to denounce that three officials had participated in the Morena candidate's campaign for the city council. The protesters asked for their immediate dismissal. The protesters were part of the movement from Strength and Heart for Mexico, PVEM and PT parties that on 20 June blocked the Mexico-Pachuca highway to ignore the municipal elections (coded separately).

notes: On 28 June 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan, teachers from National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE), marched to protest against different pending demands including the cancelation of the education reform. The protest was held at the city center.

notes: On 28 June 2024, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, a group of pensioners and retirees teachers from the National Union of Education Workers (SNTE) held a protest and demanded the dismissal of the general secretary in Mineral de la Reforma. The protesters accuse the secretary to be in power for more than five years when the terms is only three.
On 28 June 2024, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, women who were friends of a 37-year-old woman who was killed in Lerma held a protest to demand justice.
On 28 June 2024, in Tenabo, Campeche, parishioners demanded the intervention of a bishop against a priest for mismanagement of the chapel and the money he has received.

On 28 June 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the Alliance of Social Organizations held a rally in front of the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN) in support of the presidential initiative to reform the Judicial Branch of the Federation (PJF). The protesters demanded an end to corruption by judges.

On 28 June 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the Revolutionary Communist Organization (OCR) and Social Organizations gathered at the Monument to the Revolution and marched towards the Zocalo to demand for the search of a teacher who went missing on 20 June in Chimalhuacan.

On 28 June 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, around 20 people victims of hurricane Otis who did not receive packages of household goods placed on a chain and padlock at the main door of the state fiscal administration to demand support from the Secretary of Welfare.

On 28 June 2024, in Emiliano Zapata, Tabasco, residents from colonia Los Cafetales held a protest and blocked Las Trancas-Coatepec highway to demand solutions to urban infrastructure problems. The protesters used tyres to block the road.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 28 June 2024, in Venustiano Carranza, Veracruz, a group of parents from the Narciso Mendoza Primary School took over the institution to protest against the lack of response from the Ministry of Public Education (SEP) to fill the vacancy of a teacher retired since last December.

On 28 June 2024, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, members of collectives and committees of the LGBTQ+ community demonstrated with banners and flags in front of the Glorieta de los Desaparecidos as part of the Pride March. Demonstrators demanded more visibility and justice for the cases of forced disappearance and hate crimes against members of their community.

This event was also replicated in other locations in the state (coded separately).
On 28 June 2024, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, unionized state Congress workers held a protest and prevented a Congress session to take place and demand a three-year bonus of 20 thousand pesos.

On 28 June 2024, around Huay-Pix, Quintana Roo, members of the 'Transporters United' organization blocked the highway on Chetumal-Bacalar to demand compensation payments related to losses caused by the construction works of the Mayan Train. This event was also replicated in other locations in the state (coded separately).

On 28 June 2024, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, residents of several neighborhoods blocked the federal highway to Mexico to demand and end to extortion or intimidation from crimes, such as robbery, assault, floor collection, among others. The people had sticks and machetes and their faces covered and warned they will not allow these crimes to happen.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 28 June 2024, around Las Trancas, Veracruz, residents from fraccionamiento Los Cafetales blocked Las Trancas - Coatepec highway to demand to the authorities several basic services, such as public works, pavement, among others.

On 27 June 2024, around San Fernando, Tamaulipas, for the third consecutive day, sorghum producers blocked the Victoria-Matamoros highway near the San Fernando bypass against the lack of release of support resources due to the fall in the price of sorghum.

source: El Proceso; El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: On 27 June 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, around 300 indigenous people from the community of Pascala del Oro, municipality of San Luis Acatlan blocked the Sol Mexico highway around Parador del Marques demanding resources for various public works.
On 27 June 2024, in Tlapa de Comonfort, Guerrero, workers from Sanitary Jurisdiction 04 started a strike and a protest to demand the road payment that they have been owed for four months.
On 27 June 2024, in Hermosillo, Sonora, retirees and pensioners from Isssteson demonstrated outside the Government Palace to demand the supply of medicines and care from specialist doctors.

On 27 June 2024, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, lawyers started a sit-in at the office facilities of the Federal Conciliation and Arbitration Board (JFCA) to demand that the offices resume their activities. The protesters stated that this situation prevent material from being extracted and make their progress even more difficult.
On 27 June 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, teachers from the Sinaloa University started a sit-in to demand fix job allocations.

source: El Sol de Sinaloa; Noroeste; Riodoce
notes: On 27 June 2024, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, teachers, students, and relatives of a teacher who is missing since 25 June in Navolato held a protest at the State Attorney General's Office to demand for his search.
On 27 June 2024, in La Paz, Baja California Sur, a group of parents from the Antonio Verdugo Verduzco primary school closed the school facilities to protest against the lack of electricity service.

On 27 June 2024, in Saltillo, Coahuila, relatives of a 16-year-old boy who was reported missing on 21 June demonstrated outside the government palace demanding the intervention of the authorities to locate him.

On 27 June 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, people affected by Hurricane Otis from different neighborhoods held a protest at the offices of the Ministry of Finance to demand the delivery of household goods and economic support from the federal government.

On 27 June 2024, in Los Mochis, Sinaloa, members of the Municipal Coordinator for the Human Right to Housing blocked the streets near the town hall to demand that the government assign them 15 lots to resolve the demand for housing for 400 families.

On 27 June 2024, in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, residents held a demonstration against the lack of water in Colonia Nogales. The people blocked avenida Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz. The rioters hit the vehicles of drivers that tried to cross the roadblock.

On 27 June 2024, in Cuautitlan Izcalli, Mexico, members of the Truth and Justice State of Mexico collective protested outside the criminal courts to demand justice for a woman who was a victim of violence for more than five years by her partner.

admin1: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 27 June 2024, in Monte Blanco, Veracruz, residents blocked the highway Fortin-Huatusco to protest against the lack of water service.

On 27 June 2024, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, a group of teachers held a demonstration outside the facilities of the Department of Education of the State of Durango (SEED) to support the supervisor of Special Education Institutions who was dismissed for denouncing acts of corruption for 20 million pesos. The protesters asked for his reinstatement.

On 26 June 2024, near San Fernando, Tamaulipas, around 40 farmers blocked the Reynosa-Monterrey highway after the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development failed to deliver resources for the commercialization of the sorghum harvest.

On 26 June 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, cleaning workers at health centers in Acapulco demonstrated at the headquarters of the Ministry of Health to demand payment of salaries owed to them.

On 26 June 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, nearly 700 pensioners from the Ministry of Public Security and the State Attorney General's Office demonstrated at the Government Palace to demand the payment of pensions that have been pending since February. They gathered at La Avispa Interactive Museum and marched to the Government Palace.

On 26 June 2024, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, lawyers, union leaders, and workers blocked streets in front of the Special Federal Board of Conciliation and Arbitration number 39 in protest against the closure of these facilities and the consequent transfer of files and operations to Ciudad Victoria. According to the demonstrators, the transfer of files would affect the current cases and would require more economic efforts from the victims. They also argue that there is not enough staff to work in all the cases that would be transferred.

On 26 June 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, students from the Raul Isidro Burgos rural normal school in Ayotzinapa, Guerrero, accompanied by parents of the missing students marched to demand truth, justice and punishment for those responsible for the disappearance of the 43 normalistas. They gathered at the Angel de la Independencia and marched to the Hemiciclo a Juarez.

On 26 June 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, dozens of taxi drivers demonstrated demanding that the process to obtain the letter of no criminal record and the renewal of licenses for taxi transportation be resolved since without these documents they cannot work. Three groups of taxi drivers including Taxis Soberanos, Union de taxis Nuevo Leon and Taxis Lealtad gathered in front of the Government Palace, demanding a hearing to try to resolve the conflict and then marched towards the State Congress. The taxi drivers stated that the problem has been ongoing for two years.
On 26 June 2024, in Tixtla de Guerrero, Guerrero, parents of students of primary school demonstrated to demand the dismissal of the preschool director, whom they accuse of being rude and arrogant.

On 26 June 2024, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, nearly 500 people gathered in the center of the city to march and raise people's awareness about cycling rights, as well as to reject the indiscriminate use of automobiles and dependence on fossil fuels.

On 26 June 2024, in Tarimbaro, Michoacan de Ocampo, parents of students of a primary school in fraccionamiento Puerta del Sol, demonstrated to demand that registration fees be lowered, for a director to be hired, and that a supervisor be hired with public funds.

On 26 June 2024, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, members of the Parents' Committee of the Valentin Gomez Farias primary school demonstrated at the facilities of the Zacatecas Ministry of Education to demand an alternative location for teaching classes to the more than 300 former students.

On 26 June 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, residents of colonia Escandon symbolically closed an establishment owned by the family of Mayor as a protest against the opening of the business despite the fact that it violates the regulations of use of land. The demonstration took place in the parking lot of the business and concluded with the placement of stamps with the legend 'closed for illegal'.

On 26 June 2024, in Victoria de Durango, Durango, a group of teachers demonstrated outside the facilities of the Department of Education of the State of Durango, after the supervisor of special education was dismissed for denouncing acts of corruption schemes. According to the supervisor, there was no tender and instead there was a direct contract with a company that is not registered with the Treasury and that is delivering poor quality material. The director of Basic Education denied that the supervisor has been discharged, instead he was removed from the duties and was sent to the special school where he is a director.
On 26 June 2024, in Navolato, Sinaloa, relatives of a teacher who was abducted (coded separately) demonstrated to demand his release.
